page.title: 12MUSIC IN CARDINGTON,ctd.
page.content: Between the secular and the sacred lie the occasional village hall/bell fund and organ fund/ musical evenings, the last one being a particularly unusual one - the gift of a grand piano,all the way from Jamaica! Every- one participated in his/her own style, the result being a complete mixture of classical,folk,sacred,pop and saucy which was received with warmth and unity and in the best kind of village tradition. The singing of the birds,the voices of children,the sounds of artisans' machinery,church bells,villagers exchanging accepted cliches against the background of spring lambs,the howl of the wind and the beating of rain,all mingle with the formal and informal attempts at the music making of this community.
